SEARCH

Class GameModel

java.lang.Object
GameModel
public class GameModel extends Object
The GameModel class handles the game's logic Manages the board, turns, movement of pieces, and determining the winner. It updates the game state and communicates with the view to reflect the changes.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    GameModel()
    Constructs a GameModel object and initializes the board, status message, and game state.

    • getStatusMessage

      public String getStatusMessage()
      Gets the current status message of the game, typically related to piece movement or game events.
      Returns:
      The current status message.

    • clearStatusMessage

      public void clearStatusMessage()
      Clears the current status message.

    • initializeBoard

      public void initializeBoard(boolean p1First)
      Initializes the game board and sets the first player.
      Parameters:
      p1First - Indicates whether Player 1 should go first.

    • getPieceAt

      public String getPieceAt(int row, int col)
      Gets the name of the piece at a specific location on the board.
      Parameters:
      row - The row of the square.
      col - The column of the square.
      Returns:
      The name of the piece at the given location, or null if there is no piece.

    • hasPieceReachedHomeBase

      public boolean hasPieceReachedHomeBase()
      Checks if any piece has reached the opponent's home base, indicating the end of the game.
      Returns:
      true if a piece has reached the opponent's home base, false otherwise.

    • movePiece

      public boolean movePiece(int fromRow, int fromCol, int toRow, int toCol)
      Moves a piece from one square to another and handles all the related logic such as updating the board, switching turns, and checking for game-ending conditions.
      Parameters:
      fromRow - The row of the piece to move.
      fromCol - The column of the piece to move.
      toRow - The row to move the piece to.
      toCol - The column to move the piece to.
      Returns:
      true if the move is valid and successfully completed, false otherwise.

    • isPlayerOneTurn

      public boolean isPlayerOneTurn()
      Checks if it is currently Player 1's turn.
      Returns:
      true if it is Player 1's turn, false otherwise.

    • getBoard

      public Board getBoard()
      Gets the game board.
      Returns:
      The Board instance.

    • setView

      public void setView(GameView view)
      Sets the view to update the user interface.
      Parameters:
      view - The GameView instance to be used for the user interface.

    • isGameEnded

      public boolean isGameEnded()
      Checks if the game has ended.
      Returns:
      true if the game has ended, false otherwise.

    • setPlayerNames

      public void setPlayerNames(String p1Name, String p2Name)
      Sets the names of the players.
      Parameters:
      p1Name - Name of player 1
      p2Name - Name of player 2
